ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] video cards
ygData.msgSnippet: A lot of difference.  The Ti has a much faster redraw rate so graphics will look cleaner and more detailed when you turn or move.  Also faster processing and
ygData.messageBody:
A lot of difference. The Ti has a much faster redraw rate so graphics will
look cleaner and more detailed when you turn or move. Also faster
processing and memory so it cuts down on internal system lag. A better
video card can sometimes compensate for a slower system. Also, the Ti is
made from titanium which is much more heat resistant than previous cards.
So the card doesnt get as hot and there is less chance of failure later on.
Overall it's a good card for the money. I plan on getting the 128MB Ti for
my P4 once I get moved into my new apartment.

Wulfric





----- Original Message -----
From: Justin
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, January 04, 2003 1:24 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] video cards


I have a question for you all. I am picking up a GeForce4 TI 4200 64 mb
video card and I was wondering how much of a difference that was from a
GeForce4 MX440 04 mb video card. Will I see much of a difference? I was
just wondering about that because I remember a while back a discussion about
the cards on this board before. Well I would apperciate any comments on
this topic. according to the manufacturer did say theis card did better
than thier 128 mb version of the same card due to the clock speed of the
ram. Just what i have heard.
